title: WATERS GeoViewer Map Image Layer
description:
The EPA Office of Water’s Watershed Assessment, Tracking and Environmental Results system (WATERS) integrates water-related information by linking it to the NHDPlus stream network. The National Hydrgraphy Dataset Plus (NHDPlus) provides the underlying geospatial hydrologic framework that supports a variety of network-based capabilities including upstream/downstream search and watershed delineation. The WATERS GeoViewer provides easy access to these data and capabilities via the Internet on any desktop or mobile device. It implements the concepts and principles of the Open Water Data Initiative, including the hydrologic Network Linked Data Index.

This EPA GeoPlatform entry can be used as an official reference for the EPA Office of Water ArcGIS server service. EPA GeoPlatform and ArcGIS Online users are encouraged to use this reference as the underlying location to the ArcGIS Server service may change over time. As the location changes, this reference will be updated to keep consumer applications up-to-date.

This Map Image Layer contains preconfigured popups for each feature class in the map service. The popups provide access to feature level attributes.

Layer Metadata:
  • EPA Linked Data
    • 303(d) Listed Impaired Waters
    • 305(b) Assessed Waters
    • Beaches
    • Clean Watersheds Needs Survey
    • Fish Consumption Advisories
    • Fish Tissue Data
    • Facilities that Discharge to Water
    • TMDLs on Impaired Waters
    • Water Monitoring
    • Nonpoint Source Projects
  • Other Linked Data
    • USGS Streamgages
  • Surface Water Features
    • Flow Direction
    • Streams
    • Canals
    • Pipelines
    • Waterbodies
    • Coastlines
    • Catchments
    • Hydrologic Units
snippet: This Map Image Layer is configured as a wrapper around the US EPA Office of Water WATERS GeoViewer ArcGIS Server services.
accessInformation:
Maintainer: US EPA Office of Water.
Data source(s): Various federal, state, local, and water agency.  Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.
licenseInfo: The user is responsible for reading and evaluating dataset limitations, restrictions, and intended use. For additional information, please see WATERS Terms of Use and Disclaimer.
